newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinian still want peace with Israel - poll.
newsitem.headline: Palestinian still want peace with Israel - poll.

text.p: Palestinians are more pessimistic about peace moves with Israel although the majority still hope to reach a settlement, according to an opinion poll published on Thursday.
In the Jerusalem Media and Communication Centre (JMCC) survey, 71 percent of those polled said their "opinion" of the peace process had weakened since last year.
However, the poll found that 69 percent "strongly or somewhat" support the peace process while 27 percent said they "strongly or somewhat" oppose it.
Israel-PLO peacemaking plunged into crisis in March when Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's right-wing government began building a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
Asked to assess Yasser Arafat's performance as president of the Palestinian Authority, 50 percent said it was "good" in July compared to 54 percent in May.
An overwhelming majority of Palestinians, 86 percent, believed there is a "great deal or fair amount" of corruption within the Palestinian Authority, the poll showed.
The JMCC interviewed 1,197 people earlier this month. The poll has a margin of error of three percent.
